title: I see a lot of frequent ban complaints, why not return to the previous punishment system?
body:
Around the time season 5 arrived a new punishment system was added, it's basically 4 strikes and you've permanently lost your account

The issue here is that you're being treated the same way as someone who's intentionally throwing games or running it down mid as disco nunu.
A lot of the time when someone is trash talking their own team or being negative in chat, they're still trying to win the game but they're just venting frustration in chat.

Before season 5 this was handled a lot better, continued toxicity and negativity was dealt with stacking chat restrictions, this would basically stack until you would need to play for several years to ever use the chat regularly again.

I can see why this was changed back then because your ability to communicate while chat restricted was very limited but nowadays with the improved pinging system this wouldn't that big of an issue.

Back in those days you'd only get suspended by extreme cases of chat abuse like death threats or rampant racism (which is fair)

People who intentionally throw games should still be recieving bans all the way up to permanent because they're influencing the actual game.

These are just my thoughts anyway :)!

Don't get me wrong, I love the Tribunal and think it is the best system we had...on paper. The problem is that as much as this community wants to whine about toxicity, it doesn't want to take active steps to combat it. 

Also, the automated part of the system doesn't dole out permabans, just the 14 days one UNLESS what you say is REALLY REALLY bad. Final strikes for permabans are peer reviewed.
Perma bans are automated as well.  It is a 4 tier punishment system and if the IFS determines a punishment is warranted it will continue escalating to the next tier of punishment.

Personally I beleive that when you refuse to follow the rules set up by the organization that is hosting you they have the right to punish you in any way they see fit (that isn't illegal or immoral).
Would like to throw out that verbal punishments do have more steps before a perm. Trolling/inting will be given a 14 day for first offense. Verbal you usually get two strikes before that.
